class MediaVideoItem
class MediaImageItem

Detailed Description

This abstract class describes the base class for any MediaItem.

Objects are defined with a file path as a source data. {}

Definition at line 35 of file MediaItem.h.

Member Function Documentation

void gaia::media::MediaItem::addEffect ( const Effect &  effect)

Add the specified effect to this media item.

Note that certain types of effects cannot be applied to video and to image media items. For example in certain implementation a Ken Burns implementation cannot be applied to video media item.

This method invalidates transition video clips if the effect overlaps with the beginning and/or the end transition.

Parameters:
effectThe effect to apply

Reimplemented in gaia::media::MediaVideoItem.

void gaia::media::MediaItem::addOverlay ( const Overlay &  overlay)

Add an overlay to the storyboard.

This method invalidates a transition video clip if the overlay overlaps with a transition.

Parameters:
overlayThe overlay to add

Generates a black frame to be used for generating begin transition at first media item in storyboard or end transition at last media item in storyboard.

Parameters:
ClipSettingsobject android.media.videoeditor.MediaArtistNativeHelper.ClipSettings
gaia::base::Vector<Effect*> gaia::media::MediaItem::getAllEffects ( )

Get the list of effects.

Returns:
the effects list. If no effects exist an empty list will be returned.
gaia::base::Vector<Overlay*> gaia::media::MediaItem::getAllOverlays ( )

Get the list of overlays associated with this media item.

Note that if any overlay source files are not accessible anymore, this method will still provide the full list of overlays.

Returns:
The list of overlays. If no overlays exist an empty list will be returned.
virtual int32_t gaia::media::MediaItem::getAspectRatio ( ) [virtual]

Get aspect ratio of the source media item.

Returns:
the aspect ratio as described in MediaProperties. MediaProperties.ASPECT_RATIO_UNDEFINED if aspect ratio is not supported as in MediaProperties

virtual void gaia::media::MediaItem::invalidateTransitions ( int64_t  oldStartTimeMs,
int64_t  oldDurationMs,
int64_t  newStartTimeMs,
int64_t  newDurationMs 
) [virtual]

Invalidate the start and end transitions if necessary.

This method is typically called when the start time and/or duration of an overlay or effect is changing.

Parameters:
oldStartTimeMsThe old start time of the effect or overlay
oldDurationMsThe old duration of the effect or overlay
newStartTimeMsThe new start time of the effect or overlay
newDurationMsThe new duration of the effect or overlay

void gaia::media::MediaItem::setRenderingMode ( MediaItem::RenderingMode  renderingMode)

If aspect ratio of the MediaItem is different from the aspect ratio of the editor then this API controls the rendering mode.

Parameters:
renderingModerendering mode. It is one of: RENDERING_MODE_BLACK_BORDER, RENDERING_MODE_STRETCH
